AboutScreen.about_text:
DaKanji helps students of the Japanese language and people who use it.
Right now it can recognize handwritten characters, all 漢字 from 漢字検定, ひらがな (also historical ones: ゑ, etc.) and カタカナ (also historical ones: ヱ, etc.)
But the feature set will be vastly improved in the coming releases.
DaKanji is available for, [iOS](IOS), [Android](), [MacOS](), [Linux]() and [Windows]()

Also check out [my other apps.](DAAPPLAB_STORE_PAGE)
If you have problems using this app or suggestions how to improve it please report them [here](GITHUB_ISSUES), join the [discord server.](DISCORD_SERVER) or send an e-mail to daapplab@gmail.com.

The privacy police can be found [here](PRIVACY_POLICE)
AboutScreen.title: About

DrawScreen.title: Drawing
DrawScreen.tutorial_dictionary_settings: In the settings the translation service can be chosen
DrawScreen.tutorial_double_tap_prediction: A Double Tap adds the character to the search box
DrawScreen.tutorial_long_press_prediction: A long press opens the prediction in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search: Here you can search multiple characters at once
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_double_tap: A double tap empties the field
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_long_press: A long press opens the characters in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_short_press: A short press copies the characters to the clipboard
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_swipe_left: Swiping left on this field deletes the last character
DrawScreen.tutorial_predictions: The predicted characters will be shown here
DrawScreen.tutorial_short_press_prediction: A short press copies the prediction
DrawScreen.tutorial_undo: Press to undo the last stroke

HomeScreen.RatePopup_text:
Do you like DaKanji?
If that is the case a rating would be awesome and it would help this project alot!

OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_text: Just draw it and DaKanji will show the character you need.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_title: You do not know a Kanji?
OnBoarding.Onboarding_2_text: With DaKanji you can quickly lookup words using web and app dictionaries.
